C1 to drink, taking only a very small amount at a time: This tea is very hot, so sip it carefully. She slowly sipped (at) her wine.

C2 a very small amount of a drink that you take into your mouth: He took a slow, thoughtful sip of his coffee. I let her have a few sips of the water.
More examplesFewer examples He took another sip of water and glanced at his watch.Robyn raised the glass to her lips and took a first sip.The students flocked to listen to Smith tell stories between sips of tea.
